lead_paragraph: Philips, the electronics giant, said it had terminated an agreement to sell a controlling stake in its automotive and LED components business because of regulatory concerns in the United States.
snippet: Philips, the electronics giant, said it had terminated an agreement to sell a controlling stake in its automotive and LED components business because of regulatory concerns in the United States.

headline.main: Philips Halts Sale of Controlling Stake in LED Business
headline.print_headline: Philips Halts Sale of Controlling Stake in Led Business

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS)

abstract: Dutch electronics giant Philips announces that it has terminated agreement to sell controlling stake in its automotive and LED components business to GO Scale Capital; says move is due to regulatory concerns raised by Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States.
